author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: إِلى أُفُقِ أَلْطافِكَ، قَدِّرْ لِيْ يا إِلهِي ما يَنْبَغِيْ لِعَظَمَتِكَ وَأَيِّدْني فِيْ تَبْلِيغِ أَمْرِكَ عَلَى شَأْنٍ يَقُومُ بِهِ أَهْلُ القُبُورِ راكِضِينَ إِلَيْكَ وَمُتَوَكِّلِينَ عَلَيْكَ وَناظِرِينَ إِلى أُفُقِ أَمْرِكَ وَمَشْرِقِ وَحْيِكَ،
translation: Do Thou destine for me, O my God, what becometh the greatness of Thy majesty, and assist me, by Thy strengthening grace, so to teach Thy Cause that the dead may speed out of their sepulchers, and rush forth towards Thee, trusting wholly in Thee, and fixing their gaze upon the orient of Thy Cause, and the dawning-place of Thy Revelation.
